data.title: Bollywood remembers Pancham Da on his 75th birth anniversary
data.meta_description: Bollywood singers, actors and directors led by his wife Asha Bhonsle remembered music legend R.D. Burman. The stars used social media such as Twitter to pay tribute.
data.text:
Several Bollywood stars led by his singer wife Asha Bhonsle remembered music legend R.D. Burman on his 75th birth anniversary on Friday.

Singers, actors and directors took to Twitter to pay tribute to the music maestro, who was fondly called Pancham Da.

Bhonsle said, "Remembering Pancham and those special moments in time that we shared." The duo collaborated on several hit songs like Piya Tu Ab To Aaja, Chura Liya Hain Tumne and Dum Maaro Dum.

Trinamool Congress MLA Debashree Roy Debashree Roy pays tribute to R.D. Burman on his 75th birth anniversary in Kolkata on Friday

Filmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra, who worked with the music director in hit film 1942: A Love Story, tweeted, "Happy birthday week to Panchamda!" and shared a link to the song Kuch Na Kaho from the Anil Kapoor-Manisha Koirala starrer.

Music composer Vishal Dadlani wished Panchan Da on his birthday and tweeted, "75th birthday of RD Burman, aka Pancham aka (as Timbaland referred to him when he told me what a big fan he is) RD Burns!!."

Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar said, "75 years ago today, a musical genius was born. His tunes stole our hearts & do so even now. Pancham Da, you rock! We miss you."

National award-winning director Hansal Mehta remembered Burman by sharing his favourite composition of the music legend, Monmajhi Re.
